data.title: Fishing fishing fishing!
data.text: We took a walk all the way around the place, it is a very peaceful way to get back to nature. We loved seeing all the different areas to fish including the catch and release pond, good amount of parking, lots of birds and fish abound!

data.title: beautivul
data.text: It is a bird watchers paradise for sure.  They are everywhere. Trails are well maintained and easy walking.  A great family place and fishing is available.

data.title: Great place to walk and/or fish
data.text: This is a very relaxing place to go.  There are several docks that you can fish off of.  There are lots of trails for nice long walks along the water.  They even have a catch and release trophy pond with huge fish in it.

data.title: This is one gem of a park!
data.text: This park is a must see!  There are beautiful paved walkways around the park, easy access for everyone.  Fishing is available in both ponds and very kid friendly.  If you are looking for a place to spend an afternoon in a heavenly place in Nampa, come take a look here!

data.title: It was 102 degrees when we visited, but still fun
data.text: Wanted to see what birds were in the area since the last time we came through town a year ago.  It was 102 degrees outside, but we still had a good walk.  The ponds were full of water, including some new ones in the back.  Looks like residential neighborhood will be encroaching on the back (new construction subdivision), but hopefully this will not impact the "birdiness" of the locale.  My son had a good time taking photographs of dragonflies and damselflies, and we see and hear a few of the typical bird species expected.  There were quite a few folks (including kids) fishing -- the park itself was fairly free of trash -- which is great to see.  Did have a couple groups of teenage boys wandering around using foul language (hopefully this doesn't become a teen hangout), but otherwise we had no complaints.

data.title: Great fishing for kids when it is just planted.
data.text: My kids and grandkids love to go to Wilson Ponds to catch trout. The fishing is really good right after the Fish and Game has planted the trout. We bait fish off the shore and the kids can usually catch a few trout each and have some fun. It is so close and convenient that it doesn't take much pre-planning or backing. They have restrooms so we usually pack a picnic and have a great time together.

data.title: COME FOR THE FISHING, STAY FOR THE LOVE OF NATURE
data.text: These ponds have numerous trails around and through which are handicapped accessible.  The fishing is good because the water runs right out of the Fish Hatchery.  There are so many ducks and geese that it is a paradise for bird watching.  There are a few geocaches throughout the area as well as a new walking trail in and out of this area.

data.title: It's a nice place for a quick getaway.
data.text: If you're older, this might be the place for you to visit. Wheelchair accessible and easy paths to walk. One can get lost (not literally) walking through the area. It tends to attract mosquitos though so bring your spray. Also some nice fish in there.

data.title: Great Place to Fish and Walk :-)
data.text: I have been to Wilson Springs Ponds twice now to fish and walk around. The city has done an AWESOME job working with Idaho Fish and Game to keep the ponds stocked and clean. There are different ponds for different types of fish. They have a bulletin board at the entrance to the ponds, informing the public of the rules and regulations for the park. Great job, great park!

data.title: Great park for birding, fishing and exercise!
data.text: We have visited Wilson Springs Ponds several times since moving to Idaho and have found it is a great birding, fishing and recreation area in all four seasons of the year.  During the winter as many as 15 species of waterfowl can be seen.  On our recent visit we saw and photographed Canada Geese, Wood Ducks, Ring-necked Ducks, Mallards and Sea Gulls.  This beautiful park is 55 acres and offers paved paths for walking or exercising and Rainbow Trout can be found in several of the ponds. Most of the paths are bicycle free and pets must be on a leash. The ponds remain pretty much ice free in the winter because they are spring fed.  There are rest rooms and ample parking. If you are in the Boise or Nampa, Idaho area take the time to enjoy this park.
